newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian bonds end flat, await new issue Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Austrian bonds end flat, await new issue Tuesday.

text.p: 1615 GMT - Austrian bonds ended mainly flat on Monday after a subdued session, with mild pressure on medium term bonds ahead of Tuesday's issue of a new five-year bond.
"Bonds with a four and a half and five year maturity came under a bit of pressure," one trader said.
The Austrian Kontrollbank said on Monday it would issue a five-year bond with a volume of 20 billion schillings on February 25. The new bond will mature on February 28, 2002.
"That will be the lowest coupon in Europe for a long time," one trader said. "But the yield of around 4.60 percent will scare off smaller investors," he noted.
* 10 year benchmark 5.875 pct bond maturing July 2006 steady at 100.65 to yield 5.54 pct in bourse trade, quoted post-market at 100.59/100.69 to yield 5.54/53.
* At the near end, five-year 5.50 percent bond maturing March 2001 unchanged at 104.50 to yield 4.33 percent in bourse trade, quoted post-market at 104.37/104.47 to yield 4.37/34 percent.
* AGB future steady at 110.24 on turnover of 277 lots.
* 10-year spread over Germany down one basis point at minus one, five-year spread up two bps at three.
* Money market rates stable with three-month VIBOR at 3.300 and overnight money just lower at 2.97/3.22. -- Vienna newsroom, +431 53112 257
